EVBPRelatedLinks.content: Long ago, I spent a lot of time on this site, but then infinite scrolling (among other things) got the best of me. I don't really use Facebook anymore, but it exists never the less.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: facebook

EVBPRelatedLinks.content: Good riddance to Twitter/X. It was starting to go the way of FB, then Musk took over and decided to ramp up the edge-lord garbage even more. My new social of choice is BlueSky.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: bluesky

EVBPRelatedLinks.content: Did you know I make stuff other than music? It's true! While I'm no James Cameron, I have made a few music videos of varying quality (and absurdity) and posted them on the YouTubes, so I might be an Anton Corbijn at least.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: youtube

EVBPRelatedLinks.content: It goes without saying that you should check out my bandcamp page. Where else on the internet can you get free EVBP music? Pirate Bay? Psssh, as if.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: bandcamp

EVBPRelatedLinks.content: My step-father Pete Bishop has helped mix, master and produce not just my recordings, but hundreds, if not thousands of other people's recordings over the years. Heck, he's practically a member of my band at this point.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: above-petes-garage

EVBPRelatedLinks.content: My pal Jordan Schug plays cello covers of old school NES tunes over on Twitch, and he also play cello at your wedding if you have one of those.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: jordan-schug

EVBPRelatedLinks.content: Adam Boose at Cauliflower Audio subjected his ears to the most unpleasant frequencies known to man just to make The Mechanical Essence of Whiskers enjoyable for your ears. You should probably thank him.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: cauliflower-audio

EVBPRelatedLinks.content: Logan Witte, AKA Innocent Vigilant Ordinary plays a helluva drum kit on my track "Pixel Fix", but he's also one of those artists who writes the kind of deeply emotional songs that make you envious of his skills.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: innocent-vigilant-ordinary

EVBPRelatedLinks.content: Jesus Sanchez is one of the many talented musicians to contribute to my seminal (inconsequential perhaps?) album MEOW. His band Tri-Nebulous is one of the few progressive rock groups that I like. Sorry Tool fans.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: jesus-sanchez

EVBPRelatedLinks.content: Not music related, but my fiance makes very, very pretty jewelry, custom wood working, and all kinds of other things as Selua's Custom Crafts in addition to being a scary good data engineer.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: seluas-custom-crafts

EVBPRelatedLinks.content: MC Lars is just the nicest guy you have ever met. He added some lit-hop flavor to my track "Decipher This Song." Definitely check him out.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: mc-lars

EVBPRelatedLinks.content: Tony Raines has a band called Ruin Your Life, and it is a jolly good time. Punk rock at its finest.
EVBPRelatedLinks.name: ruin-your-life-band

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: Some web comics age poorly. And some web comics age like Something Positive - the author may get crankier, but he' still right.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: something-positive

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: In the era of guitar amp simulators, I find nothing more frustrating than trying to get a configuration that sounds good and is actually inspiring. Polychrome DSP, and the McRocklin Suite does a pretty good job of that.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: polychrome-dsp

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: You ever find one of those bands where you are unable to explain why you love their music, but you still do? Yeah. That would be Hiroshima for me.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: hiroshima-band

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: Even if you can't remember where, you have probably seen Tom Tomorrow's satirical (and more often than not, political) comics out here in the real world. Always a good sanity check.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: tom-tomorrow

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: It is ALWAYS a good idea to keep tabs on your local politician and find out who they are receiving money from. Open Secrets makes it easier than ever.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: open-secrets

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: My only major hang up with Amnesty International is that they ask for donations far too often for my taste. But the work they do is solid, so it doesn't bother me too much.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: amnesty-international

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: Support your local bookstore! Mine is Literati.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: literati-bookstore

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: Also support your local record store! My personal favorites are Dearborn Music, Wazoo, Encore, UHF, and Underground Sounds.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: local-record-stores-southeast-michigan

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: I am a big fan of YouTuber Caelan Conrad's video essays. Always informative with just the right amount of humor.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: caelan-conrad

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: Speaking of Caelan, I would be highly embarrassed to not mention the YouTuber that introduced me to them, Thought Slime.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: thought-slime

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: Need to spend money on some music equipment? You can't go wrong with Sweetwater. Or if you are on a budget, there is always Music Go Round.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: sweetwater

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: Back when I first started working as a software dev in Ann Arbor, my co-workers introduced me to the joy that is No Thai. My life hasn's been the same since.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: no-thai-restaurant

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: Speaking of my software dev co-workers, when the market took a hit a few years ago, one of them helped get Aha Bhiryanis off the ground, and they are now my favorite Indian restaurant.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: aha-bhiryanis-restaurant

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: Sure, there are plenty of add-ons for Chrome to hide the AI garbage at the top of the page, but there's also a way to disable it entirely as well. Just a slight heads up, you will likely need to go in and replace "google.baseURL" with www.google.com each time you restart your browser, which is annoying but still a heck of a lot better than AI overviews that can't even get the date right.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: no-ai-google-chrome

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: I tried them back when I was a teenager because they were described as being a punk rock band, but I was sorely disappointed by the lack of power chords and overly fast, snotty anthems. As an adult, I have finally grown into this pair of shoes, and they are some of the comfiest I have. Echo & the Bunnymen.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: echo-and-the-bunnymen-band

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: If you are in the software dev practice, it is your professional responsibility to challenge yourself daily. HackerRank is here to help.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: hacker-rank

NonEVBPRelatedLinks.content: Speaking of software development, WebStorm is a better IDE than VSCode in nearly every sense. Don't at me.
NonEVBPRelatedLinks.name: webstorm-ide
